variant.question:
Which of the following statements is correct? 


1) A high limit load factor enables the manufacturer to design for a lower stick force per g
 
2) The stick force per g is a limitation on the use of an aeroplane, which the pilot should determine from the Aeroplane Flight Manual.

options.text: 1) is correct and 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect and 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct and 2) is correct.
1) is incorrect and 2) is correct.

variant.question:
Which statement is correct?
 I A stick pusher activates at a higher angle of attack than a stick shaker
 II A stick shaker prevents the pilot from increasing the angle of attack further.

options.text: I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.

variant.question:
Which statement is correct? 

I A stick pusher activates at a lower angle of attack than a stick shaker
 II A stick shaker prevents the pilot from increasing the angle of attack further.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.

variant.question: Considering the longitudinal stability of an aeroplane, why does the stick force per ‘g’ decrease with pressure altitude, at a given IAS?

options.text: Because increasing pressure altitude produces a smaller aerodynamic damping.
Because the manoeuvring point is in front of the neutral point at a higher pressure altitude.
Because the aeroplane has a greater longitudinal stability at higher pressure altitude.
Because increasing pressure altitude produces a bigger aerodynamic damping.

variant.question: When moving the centre of gravity forward the stick force per g will:

options.text: increase.
change but only at very high speeds.
decrease.
not change.

variant.question:
Which statement is correct?

1. Stick force per g is independent of altitude.

2. Stick force per g increases when the centre of gravity moves forward.

options.text: I is incorrect, II is correct.
I is incorrect, II is incorrect.
I is correct, II is correct.
I is correct, II is incorrect.
is dependent on CG location.
does not change with increasing altitude.
is selected by the pilot by electronic means before each flight.
has a maximum value related to acceptable controllability, the minimum value is of no concern.

variant.question: Which statement about stick force per g is correct?

options.text: The stick force per g must have both an upper and lower limit in order to ensure acceptable control characteristics.
The stick force per g increases, when centre of gravity is moved aft.
The stick force per g can only be corrected by means of electronic devices (stability augmentation) in case of an unacceptable value.
If the slope of the stick force versus load factor line becomes negative, generally speaking this is not a problem for control of an aeroplane.

variant.question:
Which statement are correct or incorrect?
1) Stick force per g is independent of altitude.
2) Stick force per g increases when the centre of gravity moves forward.

options.text: 1) is incorrect; 2) is correct.
1) is correct; 2) is incorrect.
1) is incorrect; 2) is incorrect.
1) is correct; 2) is correct.

variant.question: If the centre of gravity moves forward, the stick force per g (1) _____ and the elevator authority (2) _____.

options.text: (1) increases; (2) decreases
(1) decreases; (2) decreases
(1) decreases; (2) increases
(1) increases; (2) increases

variant.question:
Which of the following statements is correct? 
I A high limit load factor enables the manufacturer to design for a lower stick force per g
II The stick force per g is a limitation on the use of an aeroplane, which the pilot should determine from the Aeroplane Flight Manual.

options.text: I is correct and II is incorrect.
I is correct and II is correct.
I is incorrect and II is incorrect.
I is incorrect and II is correct.
